TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IServicedComponentInfo

Docs.summary: Implemented by the class to obtain information about the component via the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo.GetComponentInfo%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IServicedComponentInfo interface does not need to be implemented directly in your code. It is used internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure.
The [GetComponentInfo(Int32,â€‚String\[\])](assetId:///M:System.EnterpriseServices.IServicedComponentInfo.GetComponentInfo(System.Int32@,System.String[]@)?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True) method does not appear in the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent>class interface. Instead, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> explicitly implements IServicedComponentInfo.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetComponentInfo (ref int infoMask, out string[] infoArray);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetComponentInfo(int32 infoMask, string[] infoArray) cil managed

Docs.param: A bitmask where 0x00000001 is a key for the serviced component's process ID, 0x00000002 is a key for the application domain ID, and 0x00000004 is a key for the serviced component's remote URI.
A string array that may contain any or all of the following, in order: the serviced component's process ID, the application domain ID, and the serviced component's remote URI.
Docs.summary: Obtains certain information about the class instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetComponentInfo method does not belong to the published interface of the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> class and does not need to be implemented elsewhere.
